byline.original: By ROBBIE BROWN and KIM SEVERSON
byline.contributor: Robbie Brown reported from Charlotte, and Kim Severson from Atlanta. Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting from New York.

snippet: Samir Khan left his comfortable life in Charlotte, N.C., for Yemen, started a magazine for jihadists and continued to dodge efforts to stop his self-described “media jihad.”
lead_paragraph: Samir Khan left his comfortable life in Charlotte, N.C., for Yemen, started a magazine for jihadists and continued to dodge efforts to stop his self-described “media jihad.”

headline.main: 2nd American in Strike Waged Qaeda Media War
headline.print_headline: Drone Victim Went From American Middle Class to Waging a Media War for Al Qaeda
headline.seo: Samir Khan, Killed by Drone, Spun Out of the American Middle Class
